channel.title: Articles | Mail Online
channel.description: MailOnline - get the latest breaking news, showbiz & celebrity photos, sport news & rumours, viral videos and top stories from MailOnline, Daily Mail and Mail on Sunday newspapers.

item.title: Britain's daily Covid cases 'will be rising exponentially again within DAYS' professor warns
item.description: Professor Paul Hunter, an epidemiologist at the University of East Anglia, said that while the decline was 'positive', the effects of Freedom Day on July 19 will not yet be appearing in the data yet.

item.title: Labour MP Dawn Butler barred from Commons for 'liar' rant
item.description: Dawn Butler was told to leave by the chair after delivering an extraordinary rant about how 'poor people have paid with their lives' because of the PM 'misleading the House'.

item.title: German TV reporter is fired after being caught smearing herself in mud before filming
item.description: Susanna Ohlen, 39, reportedly muddied herself to pretend she had lent a hand with the clean up effort in Bad Munstereifel following heavy flooding last week that claimed at least 128 lives in Germany.

item.title: Get a Covid test BEFORE heading to Cornwall because hospitals are filling up, tourism bosses warn
item.description: Visit Cornwall's chief is asking visitors to see this holiday season as a 'summer of understanding', while the region's council is asking visitors to 'respect local communities in holiday hotspots'.

item.title: Israeli company set to become world's first country to launch clinical trials of ORAL Covid vaccine
item.description: Oravax Medical's oral vaccine targets three proteins on the coronavirus rather then the single spike protein that the Pfizer-BioNTech and Moderna vaccines target.

item.title: Subpostmasters wrongly convicted in Post Office IT scandal to receive up to £100,000 each
item.description: The Court of Appeal in London this week overturned 12 more convictions against former postmasters who were wrongly convicted for vanishing funds at Post Office branches.

item.title: Collin Morikawa reveals fan snuck a speaker that made FART noises onto 18th hole at The Open
item.description: Morikawa, 24, put in a near flawless 72 holes of golf to lift his second major at Sandwich last Sunday, holding off challenges from Jordan Spieth and Louis Oosthuizen to triumph in Kent.

item.title: Inside Tom Cruise's incredible £32M motor yacht holiday in Cornwall:
item.description: The stunning vessel - named Triple Seven - was spotted in the harbour of Penzance on Thursday morning, hours after Cruise, 59, was seen boarding the boat in Mevagissey.

item.title: Police issue appeal to find hero who jumped into River Thames to save two babies from drowning
item.description: Police are searching for a mystery man who leapt into the River Thames in Staines to save two babies strapped to a buggy from drowning after their pram went into the water.

item.title: Owner of sleepy horse who naps whenever the sun is out constantly has to reassure neighbours
item.description: Six-year-old horse Marge flops completely to the ground for a bit of shut eye whenever the sun comes out, with her owner Louise Knock, 41, even hearing the animal snoring

item.title: Adorable dog goes viral for looking like a black hole
item.description: Christina Worthington, 28, from Champaign, Illinois, posted a snap of her Schipperke-breed dog Ben, earlier this year and was shocked when he quickly gained a huge fan base.

item.title: Bungling South African cops let prisoner escape - so they abduct innocent man off the street
item.description: A Cape Town magistrates court heard Warrant Officer Ricardo Snyman and Sergeant Sibuyiselo Bentso were caught out as the arrested man looking nothing like the suspect.

item.title: Internet is hit by problems as ITV, Skybet, BA and Barclays customers report online outages
item.description: Gamers, shoppers and workers across the world were left livid after they could not connect to at least 48 websites on Thursday evening.

item.title: Biden flubs answer on foreign policy work, falsely says you WON'T get COVID if you have the shot
item.description: Joe Biden overinflated the efficiency of vaccines during his gaffe-filled town hall on Wednesday. 'You're OK,' he assured. 'You're not going to - you're not going to get COVID if you have these vaccinations.'

item.title: TOWIE stars Courtney Green, Chloe Meadows and Clelia Theodorou are among 10 axed cast members
item.description: TOWIE stars Courtney Green and Chloe Meadows are the biggest casualties in the ITVBe show's mass cull that has seen 10 cast members axed, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: 13 Reasons Why star Tommy Dorfman comes out as transgender
item.description: The 29-year-old actress made the revelation in an interview with Time on Thursday, saying: 'For a year now, I have been privately identifying and living as a woman - a trans woman.'

item.title: Emily Maitlis blasts BBC for quick apology over Dominic Cummings tirade
item.description: Emily Maitlis, who has twice been rebuked by her employer for 'breaches of impartiality', accused the broadcaster of caving in to political pressure from No10 and suggested it reconsider its priorities.

item.title: Experts show how to stay alive in the water as heatwave drowning death toll hits SEVENTEEN
item.description: The RNLI is urging those who choose to take a dip during the hot weather to relax and float on their back if they get into trouble.

item.title: Doctor who gave sex-change hormones to children in unlicensed transgender clinic vows to clear name
item.description: Dr Helen Webberley was convicted in 2018 of illegally running a clinic where she treated 1,600 transgender and gender dysphoric children at her home in Wales but has vowed to clear her name.

item.title: Birds: Clever cockatoos can learn to lift BIN LIDS to gather food by copying others
item.description: Based on surveys of where people have seen the birds exhibiting this skill across the suburbs of Sydney, researchers have concluded that the ability is spreading.

item.title: Wedding planners say NHS Test and Track app 'pingdemic' threatens Britain's summer wedding season
item.description: The news comes as couples were told by Home Office minister Victoria Atkins to call off their weddings if they get pinged by the NHS app the night before they are due to get married.

item.title: Scientists 3D-print ears and noses for facial reconstruction
item.description: The Scar Free Foundation has launched a three-year £2.5 million programme of 'regenerative research' into 3D-printed facial reconstruction technology based at Swansea University.

item.title: Grizzly bear terrorized man in Alaska wilderness for days before he was rescued by helicopter crew
item.description: A Coast Guard crew was flying changed course to avoid some clouds on their way to Nome, Alaska on Friday when they spotted a man waving both arms in distress, and suffering from a leg injury.

item.title: NASA data reveals details of the core, mantle and crust of Mars
item.description: The findings were published in three studies using NASA InSight data, from the University of Cologne, the California Institute of Technology and ETH Zurich.

item.title: Make supermarket staff EXEMPT from 'Pingdemic', demands Iceland boss
item.description: MailOnline readers have shared pictures of empty shelves in dozens of supermarkets across the UK in the past 24 hours.

item.title: Survivor of Manchester Arena bomb criticises bravery awards
item.description: Martin Hibbert, 44, fell to the ground with his daughter, Eve, then 14, as Salman Abedi detonated his suicide bomb around 15ft (5m) away at Manchester Arena in May 2017.

item.title: Tommy Robinson LOSES £190,000 High Court libel case
item.description: The English Defence League founder - whose real name is Stephen Yaxley-Lennon - was sued by Jamal Hijazi, who was recorded being bullied in the playground at a school in Huddersfield.

item.title: 'We will not renegotiate': EU's Ursula Von Der Leyen slaps down Boris Johnson over Northern Ireland
item.description: The European Commission president said that the part of the Brexit agreement that has brought social and economic strife to Ulster could not be re-written, after speaking to the PM.

item.title: Covid positivity rates among travellers are 22 TIMES higher in some amber list nations than France
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Infection rates among travellers returning to England from Portugal and Spain were twice as high as France's, which is the only country under special 'amber-plus' restrictions.

item.title: Covid-19 UK: Admissions spike in FOUR FIFTHS of hospitals across England
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: NHS England figures show the number of coronavirus patients staying overnight in hospital beds increased 35.7 per cent in a week to 3,068 on July 20, the latest date data goes up to.

item.title: Architect-turned-rocker's unique self-designed London townhouse goes up for sale for £1.8m
item.description: The Brook Green, London property was designed by architect turned rock star Henry Harrison, a member of The Mystery Jets, and who was voted the 18th coolest rock star by NME magazine in 2018.

item.title: Former manager at Big Green Egg firm wins tribunal case after being 'bullied' by his American boss
item.description: Gavin Ford, 40, claimed his boss David Ezrine bullied him while he worked for Winchester-based Alfreso Concepts, sellers of 'The Big Green Egg' barbeques.

item.title: Shocking moment man leaps from roof of two-storey building 'in bid to get away from police'
item.description: Footage filmed by a passerby shows the man, who is currently unnamed, standing on top of a house surrounded by police in Walsall, near Birmingham, before slipping from the tiled roof.

item.title: Gareth Southgate, Harry Kane and Marcus Rashford get the Spitting Image treatment
item.description: The satirical comedy Spitting Image will be back on BritBox for a second series, set in Hartlepool, on September 11 after it returned to screens in 2020 for the first time in 24 years.

item.title: Pictured: Stuntman stabbed to death while filming Brixton music video
item.description: The man, named online as Shane Jerome, was fatally knifed amid chaotic scenes on Brixton High Street in South London and was pronounced dead at the scene of the attack at 8.45pm last night.

item.title: EVs are cheaper to own than petrol and diesel cars over a 7-year period
item.description: A new index calculates the average running costs based on purchase price, tax, insurance, fuel and maintenance costs. It found that EVs are around £1,300 less expensive per year.

item.title: Britain's daily Covid cases are DOWN for the first time in two months
item.description: The Department of Health said 39,906 people tested positive across the UK in the past 24 hours, marking a 17.8 per cent drop on the number last Thursday.

item.title: £15,000 subterranean 'ground fridge' keeps food cool all year round
item.description: The Groundfridge is suited to the eco-conscious homeowner and can store cheese, vegetables and wine, according to its developers, based in Arnhem, the Netherlands.

item.title: RE teacher, 49, who married ex-pupil, 23, and had two children with her is facing probe
item.description: Gavin Dunsmuir is accused of becoming involved in a relationship with Megan Reid (pictured together) while working at an Ayrshire school.

item.title: MP accused of conning council out of £64,000 held FOUR roles at group that managed council housing
item.description: Labour MP Aspana Begum held four positions with Tower Hamlets Homes, the company which provides housing services to Tower Hamlets council. She has denied three counts of fraud.

item.title: U-turn hint over threat of 14-year jail terms for journalists who use leaked Government documents
item.description: Under a consultation run by Priti Patel 's Home Office, which closes today, reporters who handle secret documents would be hit hard under laws changes designed to clamp down on spies.

item.title: Seven victims of Croydon tram crash 'were not unlawfully killed'
item.description: Dane Chinnery, 19, Philip Seary, 57, Dorota Rynkiewicz, 35, Robert Huxley, 63, Philip Logan, 52, Donald Collett, 62, and Mark Smith, 35, were killed when the tram derailed in South London in 2016.

item.title: British suspect in huge Twitter hack is jailed in Spain while he fights extradition to the US
item.description: Joseph O'Connor, who is wanted in the US in connection with last year's Twitter hack, appeared before a Spanish court and refused to be transferred to the country voluntarily and could face extradition.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg 'apologises profusely' for using anti-Asian racist phrase 'yellow peril' in Commons
item.description: The Leader of the House was criticised after he referred to the 'yellow peril' as he attacked the Liberal Democrats - whose party colours are yellow - during a debate this afternoon.

item.title: Forget The Dress, there's new optical illusions dividing the web - but what do YOU see?
item.description: Three tricky optical illusions, created by Gala Spins, show just how colours and shapes can trick the eyes. Brits were polled on what they could see depending on their unique vision.

item.title: Scientists develop an 'iron-air' battery that stores electricity for days
item.description: The battery will help tackle climate change by reducing the need for fossil fuel power plants, according to technology startup Form Energy, from Massachusetts, US.

item.title: Pennsylvania mansion tycoon built for his family before son and grandson died in Titanic sinking
item.description: Photos reveal the sad state of Lynnewood Hall in the US state of Pennsylvania. The mansion, was completed in 1900 on the orders of millionaire streetcar tycoon Peter Widener.

item.title: Finnair to trial IATA 'Travel Pass' app on flights between Heathrow and Helsinki
item.description: The International Air Transport Association (IATA), the trade body for airlines, is trialing its new 'Travel Pass' on flights between the London-based airport and Helsinki.

item.title: Covid vaccine passports WILL be required to get into Tory conference
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Tory insiders told MailOnline that proof people are double-jabbed is set to be required at the gathering in Manchester in October.

item.title: Norway's Princess Ingrid Alexandra and Prince Haakon mark ten years since Anders Breivik massacre
item.description: On July 22, 2011, right wing extremist Anders Breivik set off a bomb in the capital, Oslo, killing eight people, before heading to tiny Utoya island where he stalked and shot dead 69 people.

item.title: Student, 21, who suspected her online boyfriend is a catfish discovers he actually a Nigerian PRINCE
item.description: Esther, 21, a student from Nottingham appeared on MTV's Catfish UK last night, after her best friend Anita contacted the show with suspicious about Theo, who met Esther on Instagram.

item.title: Police and teachers slam 'whingeing' unions over 3% pay rise
item.description: Home Secretary Priti Patel has confirmed police officers earning more than £24,000 would be hit by the freeze. Those earning less will be given an annual rise of £250.

item.title: Pictured: Hero bouncer tells how he saved 18-year-old clubber being raped on Brighton beach
item.description: A club doorman who caught and detained a rapist as he attacked an 18-year-old girl on Brighton beach modestly insisted today 'I'm no hero - I was just doing my job'.

item.title: Plus-size event organiser slams hotel after accidentally receiving 'fatphobic' email
item.description: Miranda Kane, 40, from East Finchley, North London slammed a Best Western hotel after accidentally receiving an internal email saying she was not 'the clientele they want to attract'.

item.title: TOWIE star Kirk Norcross found his father Mick dead at family's Essex home, inquest hears
item.description: Mr Norcross, who had been the beloved owner of the Essex nightclub Sugar Hut, was found dead in his home in Brentwood Road, Bulphan in January this year.

item.title: Julia James' son pays tribute to murdered PCSO mother, 53, at Canterbury Cathedral funeral
item.description: The son of murdered PCSO Julia James wept as he said 'goodbye for now, but not forever' to his mother during her funeral at Canterbury Cathedral as mourners lined the streets of Aylesham.

item.title: Delhi builds 'smog tower' to improve city's polluted air but experts say it won't make a difference
item.description: The £1.4million structure is meant to filter air over a one square kilometre radius around the swanky shops and cafes in Connaught Place, a posh downtown shopping district in New Delhi.
item.media:description: A fresh air tower in Delhi will see forty giant fans push out filtered air across a one square kilometre area

item.title: Mercedes-Benz reveals its plans to be 'ready' to go all-electric by 2030
item.description: Daimler, the parent group of Mercedes, outlined its plans to invest more than €40bn (£43bn) between 2022 and 2030 in order to be ready to become an all-electric car maker.

item.title: Stay out of the sun! Met Office issues two EXTREME heat warnings
item.description: The Met Office has issued a yellow weather warning for rain in central and southern parts of England and Wales, forecasting 'widespread and locally torrential' downpours on Sunday.

item.title: Dramatic moment a £150,000 42ft yacht SINKS in the sea off Sandbanks
item.description: The owners were taking the Fairline motor cruiser called Harley towards a yacht club when it started taking on water in Poole Harbour, Dorset.

item.title: Anna Wintour's former assistant reveals what it was like to work for Vogue editor
item.description: Lily Stav Gildor, 29, who lives in LA, worked for Anna Winour from January 2014 to May 2015 and has gone viral on TikTok sharing her experiences at the fashion bible.

item.title: David Beckham officially owns the WORST team in America in Inter Miami
item.description: Players were booed back to the dressing room after Wednesday night's humbling 5-0 loss to New England Revolution and what was supposed to be an American dream is fast becoming a nightmare.

item.title: Archaeology: Roman road discovered submerged in the Venice lagoon
item.description: The remains of structures on the lagoon bed that are lined up as if along a straight road have been revealed in a sonar scan taken by researchers from Venice's Institute of Marine Sciences.

item.title: French warship escorts migrant boat into UK waters
item.description: Priti Patel's 'ridiculous' £54million migrant deal with France has sparked a Tory backlash, with MPs telling her to get tough with French authorities 'fobbing her off with excuses' as the Channel crisis spirals.

item.title: He's roaring trunk! Baby elephant rolls around in Botswana waterhole
item.description: Photographer and guide Janet Kleyn, 53, captured the elephant's fall at the Mashatu Game Reserve in Botswana.

item.title: Summer cold season is worse than ever after a year of masking and social distancing
item.description: The flu is making a return in summer 2021, and cases are more serious than before. Infants are being struck especially hard by viruses that are spreading once again after a year off.

item.title: Britons brace for 'Great Getaway' seeing almost 400,000 head abroad this weekend
item.description: With the end of quarantine for the fully vaccinated and children visiting amber list countries coming at the end of the school year for most pupils, packed flights are expected to leave the UK this weekend.

item.title: Martin Lewis reveals how YOU can claim £125 if you're pinged
item.description: In a recent Money Saving Expert newsletter, Martin Lewis explains how Britons who've been forced to work from home after being 'pinged' can claim for expenses incurred.

item.title: Baby pterosaurs flew the nest straight after hatching, study claims
item.description: Extinct flying reptiles called pterosaurs were 'flightworthy from the moment of hatching', experts at the universities of Southampton, Portsmouth and Bristol report.

item.title: Highways England could have to remove tons of CONCRETE used to fill arches beneath railway bridge
item.description: Eden District Council in Cumbria told the government's roads authority that it had to apply for retrospective planning permission for the scheme in Great Musgrave.

item.title: UK's most sugary summer drinks revealed - Pret a Manger's Chocolate Shake takes first place
item.description: Using the nutritional information provided on each of the high-street chain's websites, Brewsmartly.com ranked each drink according to the sugar content.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Games' opening ceremony director SACKED on the eve of the event over Holocaust jokes
item.description: Kantaro Kobayashi, a 48-year-old comedian, has been sacked as director of the Tokyo Olympics opening ceremony just a day before it is due to be performed after Holocaust jokes resurfaced online.

item.title: Terrifying moment roof is ripped off by wind and smashes down onto Russian girl's head
item.description: The young girl, named Anastasia, is in intensive care have suffered serious head injuries in the freak incident which saw the enormous metal roof hurtle through the air before crashing down on her.

item.title: There's a FOX in my kitchen: Couple discover bushy-tailed intruder hiding behind their microwave
item.description: Housewife Karen East woke up to a fox in her kitchen after falling asleep on the sofa at her home in Buckhurst Hill, Essex.

item.title: Man is branded 'ridiculous' for threatening to 'report' resident for sunbathing in 'communal garden'
item.description: An anonymous man, 29, who lives in the UK, took to Reddit and slammed his female neighbour for sunbathing in her bikini in the 'communal garden' outside their residence.

item.title: Festivals are back! 40,000 revellers flood into Latitude for the first major music event since 2019
item.description: Smiling campers armed with sleeping bags, rucksacks and suitcases queued on the grass in the sunshine this morning before entering the campsite at Henham Park in Suffolk.

item.title: Olympic chiefs say they WILL show footballers taking the knee on their social media channels
item.description: Players from five women's soccer teams - including Team GB - took the knee in support of racial justice in Japan on Wednesday. But the images were excluded from official Olympic social media.

item.title: Zahawi says ex-pats vaccinated abroad will be able to skip UK quarantine rules by end of month
item.description: UK citizens who received their coronavirus vaccine while abroad will be able to return home from amber list countries without quarantining by the end of the month.

item.title: Conwoman, 60, accused of swapping £4.2m worth of diamonds for pebbles
item.description: Lulu Lakatos, 60, is alleged to have stolen seven the stones from Mayfair jeweller Boodles in central London in March 2016 while posing as a gemologist called 'Anna'.
item.media:credit: Jamie Wiseman for The Daily Mail

item.title: Chinese billionaire gets go-ahead to demolish £205m Knightsbridge mansion and build a £500m home
item.description: Westminster City Council this week rubber-stamped Hong Kong-based tycoon Cheung Chung Kiu's proposals for the lavish property, which include an extended basement and a 'halo' roof.

item.title: Meet the Team GB women's football squad ALREADY showing their skill at Tokyo 2020
item.description: Team GB women's football squad sent a statement after cruising past Chile in their Olympic opener last night - but who are the ultra-glamorous players going for gold?

item.title: Southampton mother jailed for nine years over death of six-week-old son Malakai Watts
item.description: Chelsea Cuthbertson, 28, of Southampton, Hants, was jailed after shaking six-week old Malakai Watts, causing him to suffer a deadly head injury and left him needing life-support.

item.title: Heathrow Airport to introduce £5 passenger drop-off charge for cars and taxi drivers from October
item.description: The £5 charge will be brought in from October and will apply to all vehicles - including taxis and private hire cars - entering the forecourt areas outside the London airport's terminals.

item.title: Woman tells how she was groped by swimmers off Bournemouth beach where girl, 15, was raped
item.description: A woman has told of being groped by perverted bathers in the same area of the sea off Bournemouth where a 15-year-old girl was raped.

item.title: Businesswoman is cleared of fleeing crash because she was 'stressed'
item.description: Andrea Francis, 66, accidentally scraped a stationary Audi as she unsuccessfully tried to reverse into a parking bay to pick up items from a shop in a Cheshire village.

item.title: Horrific moment grandfather-of-two, 76, ends up under the wheels of oncoming van
item.description: Alan Thompson, a grandfather-of-two, was left in 'excruciating' pain after he careered into a van on his way back to a Peak District car park following an intense bicycle ride..

item.title: Men have a bigger carbon footprint than women because they purchase high-emitting goods
item.description: Single men, on average, produce 16% more greenhouse emissions than single women, despite males only spending two percent more on goods, a new study reveals.

item.title: Australia and New Zealand WITHDRAW from Rugby League World Cup in England amid coronavirus fears
item.description: NZRL chief Greg Peters cited 'stark differences' between the management of the pandemic in the UK and Australasia and said it was 'simply too unsafe' for the teams to take part in the tournament.

item.title: Peers warn 'Online Safety' laws could threaten freedom of speech
item.description: An influential cross-party committee cautioned that 'legitimate debate' is at risk of being 'stifled' by the way major platforms filter out 'misinformation'.

item.title: Pat Garrett's gun used to kill Billy the Kid 140 years ago is going under the hammer for $3million
item.description: Wild West outlaw Billy the Kid was gunned down by Sheriff Pat Garrett with a single action revolver at his ranch hideout in Fort Summer, New Mexico, on July 14, 1881.Now, Garrett's gun is for sale.

item.title: Woman reveals she's welcomed 30 refugees into her home - to fill gap when her daughters left home
item.description: Karina Litvack, from West London, says she 'wouldn't be here' if a stranger hadn't taken in her grandparents after they escaped Auschwitz. Since 2017, she's housed around 30 refugees.

item.title: Giles Coren's home daubed with 'Dawn Foster Forever' after he 'mocked the death of journalist'
item.description: Times columnist Giles Coren's house in London was daubed in graffiti after he posted 'sickening' tweets mocking the death of a person thought to be journalist Dawn Foster, who allegedly 'trolled' him.

item.title: Covid UK: Domestic abuse, fraud and hacking soar during pandemic
item.description: Criminals used the Covid pandemic as cover to commit more fraud, hacking and domestic abuse offences, according to new figures.

item.title: Medical students at University of Exeter are offered £10,000 cash to defer
item.description: The number of school leaves wanting to study medicine at the UK Russel Group university has surged by 20% this year, putting it in danger of breaching a government-imposed cap on numbers.

item.title: Images taken after WWII show families enjoying themselves at Butlin's camps
item.description: One image taken at Clacton-on-Sea in 1946 shows women waving as they ride tandem bikes along the seafront at the then enormously popular resort, in Essex.

item.title: Student, 26, who was first Briton known to have caught Covid died after taking cannabis and pills
item.description: Connor Reed, 26, from Llandudno, caught the virus while teaching English at a school in Wuhan in November 2019, and claimed he drank hot toddies to help him beat the illness.

item.title: Unions threaten to strike over 'paltry' 3% NHS pay offer
item.description: Unions have been raging about the increase for nurses and other staff, which will be backdated to April, demanding up to 15 per cent after coronavirus heaped pressure on services.

item.title: Hilarious social media posts reveal ridiculous lies
item.description: Myhealthgazette.com has rounded up examples from around the world, detailing acts of heroism, profound encounters with strangers and displays of talent so incredible that it's hard to believe they happened.

item.title: Jacob Rees-Mogg says it is 'reasonable' for MPs to shun masks in the Commons
item.description: Jacob Rees-Mogg said it was not necessary to wear a mask because there was an 'amazing' amount of space - jibing that many of Opposition politicians already appear to have gone on holiday.

item.title: Ferrets UK: Hilarious moment pet owner tries to get eight lively animals into a cat carrier
item.description: Mike and Gill Shaw, from Chester, own three adult ferrets and five kits, and have struggled to contain them as they transport them between their day pen and night hutch.

item.title: Smart meters will be USELESS in hydrogen-powered homes
item.description: Business Secretary Kwasi Kwarteng said new smart meters that work on hydrogen boilers - a possible future greener alternative to conventional gas boilers - would have to be installed.

item.title: Junior health minister Jo Churchill joins Sajid Javid, Boris Johnson and Rishi Sunak in quarantine
item.description: Junior health minister Jo Churchill announced Thursday she was pinged by the NHS coronavirus app and will be required to quarantine, joining Health Secretary Sajid Javid

item.title: Russia disconnects from global internet in tests sparking fears Putin will clamp down on free speech
item.description: The country adopted legislation, known as the 'sovereign internet' law, in late 2019 that seeks to shield the country from being cut off from foreign infrastructure.

item.title: British schoolgirl billed by mother as the 'next Greta Thunberg' becomes youngest-ever TED talker
item.description: Molly Wright, 7, an aspiring actress who was born in the UK but who now lives in Australia, has become the youngest person ever to deliver a TED Talk.

item.title: Birmingham restaurant issues furious rant against customers
item.description: Alex Claridge, chef-owner of The Wildnerness, a modern British fine dining resturant in Birmingham, told Femail he was 'flabbergasted' by customers who are cancelling reservations.

item.title: Ordnance Survey adds peculiar local nicknames to UK coastal areas
item.description: The tool lets emergency response staff quickly locate the location of an accident, according to Southampton based Ordnance Survey.

item.title: Woman with unattached bungee cord jumps to her death after hearing a signal meant for her boyfriend
item.description: Yecenia Morales, 25, fell 150ft from the viaduct in Amaga, northern Colombia, on Sunday after she jumped without a bungee cord attached.

item.title: Pensioner's headless body was found in woods by family walking their dog
item.description: A family walking their dog found the headless body of a missing murdered pensioner in woods at Salcombe

item.title: Meghan's estranged half-brother Thomas Markle Jr joins Big Brother VIP in Australia
item.description: Thomas Markle Jr, 54, was spotted by staff at Sydney Airport today before going into hotel quarantine, where he will stay for 14 days before he can appear on Big Brother VIP.

item.title: Man who underwent world's first double arm and shoulder transplant can now flex his biceps
item.description: Icelandic former electrician Felix Gretarsson, 49, lost both of his arms in an electrical accident in 1998, which saw the limbs set alight after he was shocked while trying to fix a powerline.

item.title: Runaway Saudi Princess Latifa and Jordan's Princess Haya are named as targets of Pegasus phone hack
item.description: According to an announcement by Amnesty International on Wednesday, Saudi Arabia's Princess Latifa and Princess Haya were both hacked.

item.title: Italy's Euro 2020 victory open-top bus parade through Rome sent cases rocketing
item.description: Covid cases in Rome have rocketed five-fold in the ten days since their victory, and now make up a fifth of all infections in the country. They currently average more than 6,000 a day.

item.title: Lord of the Rings: Underwater volcano off the coast of Australia resembles the 'Eye of Sauron'
item.description: The feature was mapped using underwater sonar during an voyage exploring the Indian Ocean undertaken by researchers with CSIRO, the Australian research agency.
item.media:credit: Phil Vandenbossche & Nelson Kuna/CSIRO, Author provided

item.title: Astronomers discover a moon-forming disc around a giant Jupiter-like exoplanet
item.description: The new moons were created from a dusty circle surrounding a gas giant world that is 370 light years from the Earth, explained astronomers from University of Grenoble, France.

item.title: Terrors from the deep: Russian fisherman shows off alien-looking sea creatures caught by his trawler
item.description: Russian fisherman Roman Fedortsov, 39, scours for cod, haddock and mackerel on commercial trawlers but also reels in a variety of bizarre-looking sea creatures from the depths.

item.title: Probe into Lex Greensill lobbying scandal highlights errors - and criticises ex-PM David Cameron
item.description: The long-awaited report about Greensill Capital, the collapsed financial company that the former prime minister lobbied ministers for, was published today on the last day of Parliamentary term.

item.title: Woman pictured at Buckingham Palace in 1943 is identified as British RAF ace's Polish widow
item.description: Poland's Institute of National Remembrance (IPN) appealed for help when they posted an image on Facebook of an unidentified dark-haired woman in uniform who was holding a red box.

item.title: More than 1.8million Britons say they are suffering from 'long Covid', survey finds
item.description: Scientists are not sure exactly how many people are suffering from the condition which sparks symptoms including fatigue. Politicians said the results were 'even worse than feared'.

item.title: Duke of Edinburgh's love of Scotland goes on display at a Holyroodhouse exhibition
item.description: Photographs taken of the Prince Philip: A Celebration at Holyroodhouse reveal the casket presented to the Duke with the Freedom of the City of Edinburgh.

item.title: Beijing condemns 'disrespectful' WHO plan to audit Chinese labs in Covid origins probe
item.description: The WHO said last week a second stage of the probe should include audits of Chinese research centres amid increasing speculation about the lab leak theory and pressure from the US.

item.title: Olympics vice-president is dubbed a 'mansplaining dinosaur' after publicly berating state premier
item.description: IOC vice-president John Coates denied the bullying allegations on Thursday after he chastised Queensland Premier Annastacia Palaszczuk over her plans not to attend the event.

item.title: Italian skydive: Daredevil untangles his parachute lines after they get twisted
item.description: Marine engineer Toms Vajeika, 30, was taking part in a skydive alongside his girlfriend and 25 others over Faro, Italy, on July 11.

item.title: Tom Hanks' 33-foot 'silver bullet' Airstream trailer to be sold at auction for around $250k
item.description: The caravan was bought new by Hanks in 1992 to his exact specifications because, in his words, he had 'spent too much time in regular trailers with ugly decor and horribly uncomfortable furniture'.

item.title: Kate Middleton has 'taken ownership of Cambridge children's image', royal expert claims
item.description: Speaking to The Telegraph, royal expert Camilla Tominey said the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge have created a 'unique model' to protect their children's privacy.

item.title: Boycotting Israel is a 'new form of terrorism', President Herzog claims
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog took aim at boycotts and the BDS movement in remarks on Wednesday, following a decision by Ben & Jerry's not to sell ice cream in the West Bank & Jerusalem.

item.title: Uber passenger, 36, says driver abandoned her at night as she was being sexually harassed
item.description: An Uber customer claims a driver 'abandoned' her by the side of the road in Berkshire in the middle of the night - despite her messaging him to she was being followed and being harassed.

item.title: Woman with 34HH breasts told by doctor not to have a reduction as women pay for her lovely breasts
item.description: Victoria Gilbert, 28, from Brentford, West London, suffers with chronic back pain from her large 34HH breasts and wants to raise £6,500 to fund a private breast reduction operation.

item.title: Real life hot priest is married! Old Etonian vicar who became a lockdown sensation weds girlfriend
item.description: Pat Allerton, 42, a vicar in Notting Hill who attracted hoards of female fans during lockdown, married Kirsty Turnbull, 33, in an intimate ceremony earlier this month.

item.title: How is YOUR neighbourhood getting on in the third Covid wave?
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Fewer than half of over-80s living in inner-city areas of England are fully-vaccinated against Covid, MailOnline can reveal.

item.title: Artist 'unwraps' a classic picture taken by Neil Armstrong on the Apollo 11 mission
item.description: To create the panorama, artist Michael Ranger, who goes by rg1213, zoomed in on the reflection of the lunar surface in Buzz Aldrin's visor and 'unwrapped it'.

item.title: BBC is dominated by 'posh English white blokes', says Channel 4 editor
item.description: Dorothy Byrne, 69, who was born in Paisley, Scotland, told a Radio 4 debate today that BBC journalists 'see themselves as sitting impartially sitting in the middle, but they define what the middle is'.

item.title: Prince Harry's memoir will focus on Princess Diana's death and who he blames, his biographer claims
item.description: Royal author Angela Levin took to Twitter and claimed a 'well-informed source' told her that Prince Harry's memoir will focus on Princess Diana's death in Paris, August 31, 1997 and who he blames.

item.title: Tricky seek-and-find puzzle challenges players to spot the invitation among the wedding guests
item.description: A tricky new brainteaser, created by The 1:1 Diet by Cambridge Weight Plan, challenges puzzlers to spot the invitation among the wedding guests. But can you beat the 31-second record?

item.title: Angelina Jolie's former friend says he's NOT '100 per cent sure' Maddox is an orphan
item.description: Sarath Mounh became friends with Jolie through his NGO in Cambodia. He assisted in her son Maddox's adoption by signing papers stating that he was the boy's father even though he was not.

item.title: Hotel quarantine guards accused of sexual harassment
item.description: One woman at a UK quarantine hotel said a guard repeatedly knocked on her door and sent her a note saying she was 'fit'.

item.title: First death from Bitcoin mining: Man is electrocuted while trying to power up faulty computer
item.description: Danai Makmek, 26, died on Tuesday in Thailand's central Chonburi province while attempting to fix his sprawling cryptocurrency mining machine, worried out the loss of income of it being out of commission.

item.title: Boris Johnson faces Cabinet revolt over social care plan
item.description: Boris Johnson, Chancellor Rishi Sunak and Health Secretary Sajid Javid are believed to be on the verge of agreeing a 1p increase on NI contributions to raise up to £10billion a year.

item.title: Women reveal the small things they would change about their husbands
item.description: Posting anonymously on UK-based forum Mumsnet, users have taken the opportunity to vent about the small things they wish they could change about their partner.

item.title: Experts demand No10 'urgently' releases data behind new amber-plus list restrictions for France
item.description: Ministers say travellers from France must now quarantine because of the South African 'Beta' variant. But figures show Spain and Greece have more cases of the mutant strain.

item.title: SUE REID exposes military planning behind the £130m migrant misery trade
item.description: An investigation by SUE REID has revealed the full scale and professionalism of the criminal trafficking network, which is worth millions of pounds, funnelling migrants onto Britain's beaches

item.title: Pensioner, 72, finds 150lb seal sunning himself in her back garden - 20 miles from the nearest sea
item.description: The wayward seal, known as Dandy Dinmont, was spotted sunbathing in the garden of Anne Page in Lincolnshire and was more than 20 miles from the coast where its colony is situated.

item.title: PAUL THOMAS on... birthday presents
item.description: 'Uncle Harry's given me a diary to start keeping - he said I'd never know when I might need one'

item.title: STEPHEN GLOVER: The EU's pettiness over food exports is proof it's many sandwiches short of a picnic
item.description: Will future school children learn about how a row over sausages led to a crisis in which Britain's major ally, America, became hostile, and its former EU partners turned nasty?

item.title: Royal Mail plans to stamp out Saturday letter deliveries and signed-for parcels
item.description: Simon Thompson, the Royal Mail's new UK boss, is looking at the controversial changes as part of a six-month review to modernise the service and push through big cost savings.

item.title: Electric vehicles release fewer greenhouse gases even charged on grid using 'dirty' power like coal
item.description: A new study finds electric vehicles release less greenhouse gas over the life of the car than gas guzzlers, even in regions where the energy grid relies on coal or other non-renewable sources.

item.title: Schools minister says 'no reason why children shouldn't learn from dead white men'
item.description: Nick Gibb, speaking virtually to the Social Market Foundation think tank today, discussed the importance of a knowledge-rich curriculum in raising UK school standards.

item.title: The Olympic mothers who really do deserve a medal!
item.description: Olympic organisers reversed a covid ban on the babies of athletes travelling to Japan. Team GB Olympians reveal how they balance the demands of professional sports with being a mother.

item.title: Brown scorpion and its babies glow stunning shades of blue and purple under UV after light
item.description: A new video captures the mysterious glowing of scorpions that occurs when the arachnid is exposed to UV light. The clips shows a mother carrying babies on it back that turn unnatural colors.

item.title: Moment terrified saleswoman sprints across front yard and hides behind barbecuing neighbor
item.description: Brad Cooper, 43, from Cartersville, Georgia, was cooking on his grill when the saleswoman used him as a human shield. And Mr Cooper said she still tried to sell him solar panels after the ordeal.

item.title: Norway's beach handball team show off their stunning figures in skimpy swimsuits on Instagram
item.description: Norway's beach handball team have shown off their stunning physiques in skimpy swimsuits on social media, after last week being fined £1,300 for refusing to wear bikinis while competing.

item.title: UK house sales hit record levels in June with monthly transactions up 216.1% up on previous year
item.description: HM Revenue and Customs (HMRC) found an estimated 213,120 sales took place in June as buyers desperately tried to complete deals before the stamp duty holiday deadline.

item.title: How England is starting to IGNORE Test and Trace amid 'pingdemic' chaos
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Experts said. the data was reminiscent of the start of the second wave, when the performance of the £37billion programme also dipped.

item.title: Two-bedroom flat in a converted Scottish castle can be yours for only £220,000
item.description: This unique two-bedroom flat is part of a Scottish castle dating back to the fifteenth century and is available to buy for a mere £220,000.

item.title: Obese Britons with long Covid put on radical low-calorie diets to see if it can cure condition
item.description: Glasgow University researchers will recruit 200 overweight and obese Britons who have survived Covid, but are debilitated by lingering symptoms months later.

item.title: Graphs show surge in cases among men in their twenties... and spike coincides with Euro 2020
item.description: England's chief medical officer warned Britain was 'not out of the woods yet' and could still be forced to consider another lockdown in weeks. His comments came after deaths rose to a four-month high.
